meanings.definition: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
meanings.sent1: The rubber ball was resilient, bouncing back immediately after hitting the ground.
meanings.sent2: Plants are resilient, growing back after a harsh winter.
meanings.sent3: The resilient toy soldier kept standing tall even after being knocked down by the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her resilient spirit was like a sturdy oak tree, weathering any storm that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The resilient mountain goat effortlessly climbed the steep cliffs, showing its strength and agility.

meanings.definition: Able to recoil or spring back into shape after bending, stretching, or being compressed.
meanings.sent1: The elastic band was resilient, stretching easily and returning to its original size.
meanings.sent2: The memory foam pillow is resilient, always regaining its fluffy shape.
meanings.sent3: The resilient slinky toy entertained the children as it bounced down the stairs.
meanings.sent4: His resilient attitude was like a boomerang, always coming back with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The resilient trampoline absorbed the impact of each jump, providing a fun and safe experience.
